fields.description:
Some customers have their JIRA instances set up behind various authentication mechanisms that require basic authentication (e.g. siteminder) and this breaks the trusted apps integration because we need to authenticate before we can make HTTP requests. 

If we could specify a HTTP Auth Username/password like the JIRA FishEye plugin then we could support such configurations.
fields.summary: Add support for basic authentication credentials for JIRA servers
Editing functionality for projects with long project names is lost on certain screen resolutions

fields.description:
The Avatar func test seems to be dumping the following files:

{code}
? var/data/avatars/ce/ce86d7d02a229acfaca4b63f01a1171b.image
? var/data/crudb/crucible.log
? var/data/crudb/crucible.properties
{code}


After a test run, the only modified files should be in the output dir.
fields.summary: Ensure no files are dumped outside of the output/ dir during func test run

fields.description:
We initialise the control port as follows: 

{code:java}mSvr = new ServerSocket(mBind.getPort(), 0, mBind.getInetAddress());{code}

-That opens the server socket with a backlog of 0 which means requests will not be queued.- A backlog of 0, causes the JVM to use the default backlog value of 50, which means requests are queued correctly.

That means if for example you issue multiple rescan requests in quick succession you may end up getting connection refused errors: 

{noformat}
Problem connecting to 127.0.0.1:8059 : Connection reset
java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:185)
        at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.readBytes(StreamDecoder.java:282)
        at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.implRead(StreamDecoder.java:324)
        at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.read(StreamDecoder.java:176)
        at java.io.InputStreamReader.read(InputStreamReader.java:184)
        at java.io.BufferedReader.fill(BufferedReader.java:153)
{noformat} 

-Perhaps we should increase the backlog.-
fields.summary: Control port connection refused problems when using the command line tools

fields.description: Lots of our customers are asking for this feature. They want that there should be some mechanism in crucible by which they can import their existing reviews in crucible from some other tool or from excel(csv).
fields.summary: Importing review from different tool into Crucible

fields.description: Only the person who commented in the review files can modify the comment. Lets say while reviewing I have raised a defect and that defect has some fields associated with it. But If other wants to update the field of the defect he should have edit permission to the defect which is only available to the creator of that defect (i.e, to the person who created that comment as defect). This default permission should be customizable.
fields.summary: Add comment editing to the permission scheme

fields.description: If someone responds to a comment (defect/Comment), the tool counts that as another comment and lists in the report whereas this is a response to the original comment only and may even be a closure comment. Each comment irrespective of the type should be an entity with its state management and sub-comment handling.
fields.summary: Response to a comment/defect should not be considerd as a separate comment

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20101106-eeja1b22487wfiuq7ij56jmi8u.jpg!
fields.summary: Repository List page is misaligned when browser font is smaller

fields.description:
Upgrades to our dependencies: we are currently on July
* https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Common+Module+Upgrade+Pack+-+2010-10
* https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Common+Module+Upgrade+Pack+-+2010-09
* https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Common+Module+Upgrade+Pack+-+2010-08

Will need to follow work to upgrade to AUI 3.2 (separate task for blue team)
fields.summary: Upgrade to October Common Module

fields.description:
When I did the code for the maintenance page page I thought it needed to stand alone, not needing access to external resources (CSS and images).

It should actually use external css and images, not have the css and images embedded in the jsp. The stylesheet and images used for the set-up screens could be used here too.

See review CR-FE-3911 for context
fields.summary: Maintenance page should use external css and images, not

fields.description:
Disabling UAL or one of its dependencies causes fatal issues for FE (dashboard fails, for example).

We need to ensure the following plugins can not be disabled via the admin plugins interface, or any other mechanism:

* UAL
* OAuth
* SAL
fields.summary: Need to prevent UAL (and dependent) plugins from being disabled.
Mini-blitz to generate use cases
EAC Blog & Use Case Page
Analyse instrumentation logs
Wrangle log publishing
Deploy to EAC/C
Deploy to AtlasEye & AtlasEye-QA
Extract quicksearch use cases from developers
Add filters for restricting text matches
Quicksearch results items UI improvement
Instrument quicksearch performance and accuracy
Add slurp teststo performance build (space & time)
Add quicksearch tests to performance build
Spike limiting result rendering to visible results
Investigate better leverage of Lucene

fields.description:
Hovering over this text in Chrome does not changed the underlined text into a clickable href

Might be same bug as in CRUC-2148
fields.summary: 'Mark all comments as read' not clickable in Chrome on Mac
Functional test for GWT and legacy JSP menus

fields.description:
When creating a patch from {{hg diff}}, Crucible doesn't anchor the diff to the repository correctly.

It seems to understand how many paths to strip from the prefix, but doesn't know about the revisions.
fields.summary: Patch reviews from mercurial diffs don't anchor to their repository

fields.description:
Dylan from the Jira team pointed out that if you are the Author of a review where you are not the moderator it is confusing that you don't get a complete button. Specifically, Anton created a review of Dylan's commit, Dylan responded and then came to ask what he was supposed to do next. 

IIRC we removed the author from being able to complete in the push to remove any unnecessary steps from the default workflow. Possibly we went too far in this instance.

h4.This seems to have been broken in later releases.  We have Author with permission to complete and uncomplete but the author never sees that option.
fields.summary: Author should be able to "complete" - broken in 2.4
Change build to allow for use of UIObject.ensureDebugId() in GWT code for functional tests

fields.description:
I'm probably part of the problem, but it seems like our stylings on fecru-autocomplete-dropdown-icon are ever-changing.  We fix one dropdown only to break another one.

I think we need to redo the css on it, and possibly its parent element so it works everywhere.

As of now here is where we are styling it:
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/28f570f7-b817-4c14-ab06-d05015b23744/2010-11-03_1240.png!

It currently looks terrible in the file history filter:
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/fa69c819-02dc-4ad0-9b02-764b10c0b5ba/2010-11-03_1245.png!
and also on the create snippet page (esp. in IE8):
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/7c329625-9f1a-4adf-b62b-7f00d7c677b6/2010-11-04_1752.png!
and in the branch selector:
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/06c83bc1-f42f-4719-aa53-5e33ad0102b2/2010-12-06_1511.png!

But please be sure that you don't ruin any of the other usages:
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/19f59197-16f8-4fa9-8778-76172cf80675/2010-11-03_1244.png!
fields.summary: Our dropdown styles are constantly being ruined in IE - we need a styling that works in all scenarios.

fields.description:
IE's console shows the warning "SEC7111: HTTPS security is compromised by about:/crucible/avatar/gcrain?s=19" when using
{code}background-image: url('{a relative url}') {code}

This can be resolved using absolute urls.

Found in Review > Edit Details > reviewer avatars.
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/5c7d468b-1f0b-4c4f-9715-098444026ac0/2010-11-03_1051.png!
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/b3841242-079e-43b1-bab2-865d951cf406/2010-11-03_1055.png!
fields.summary: IE - use of relative url in background-image in inline styles which are loaded in via javascript causes bogus security warning ("about:/")

fields.description: Both getting and setting recent items, for multiple users at the same time.
fields.summary: Modify performance framework to test recent items

fields.summary: NPE coming from Review Report Chart

fields.description:
Fisheye 2.4.x has an updated backup screen and instructions/procedure for changing the backup path.
[This|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Backing+Up+and+Restoring+FishEye+Data#BackingUpandRestoringFishEyeData-SchedulingFishEyeBackups] screenshot appears to be outdated and lacks instructions for updating the {{config.xml}} file from the {{config.xsd}} file.
It would be good to have an example there for changing the backup path by updating the {{config.xml}} file. I found [this|http://www.15seconds.com/issue/031209.htm] to be a good reference for understanding the {{xsd}} format.
The screenshot from 2.4.1 is attached for reference.
fields.summary: Fisheye 2.4 backup documentation needs new screenshots and instructions

fields.description:
The [documentation states|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Allow+(Process)#Allow%28Process%29-AddinganExclude]:

{quote}	Changes to Includes and Excludes do not take effect until the repository is restarted. If you do not re-index when changing the includes and excluded, files and directories which have been indexed prior to the update will remain visible in FishEye.{quote}

We should add the message to this screen: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20101101-n3a4fw87yi912nyfk5e5gfr9i1.jpg!
fields.summary: Add message to Allow (Process) section in repository admin to warn a reindex might be needed.

fields.description:
When querying for reviews via the /filter api and the same query via the /search api, 
different numbers of results are reportedly appearing, when they should be the same.
fields.summary: Different results returned from REST /filter as opposed to /search API.

fields.description: Story to encompass gwt admin page tests
fields.summary: Functional Tests for GWT Admin

fields.description:
The repository admin page now allows filtering and a back/next page widget for each repo list (native and scm repos).
The filter for native repos will do a match on any of the the columns Name, Type, Description, Location or State. So for example you could filter on all the repos named "foo" by typing "foo" or you could filter on the disabled repos by typing "disabled". Filtering is not case sensitive.

Would you be able to update the screenshots and any documentation necessary? Ta!
fields.summary: Document the new filter and paging for the repository list in FECRU admin

fields.description:
1. Link an issue to a review.
2. Add a comment, mark it as a defect.
3. Close the issue
4. Try and create an issue from the comment you made in 2.

The Create issue dialog presents the following options:

!http://img.skitch.com/20101101-cida4s79t7pmacnpch3913a5i7.png!


If the linked issue to the review is closed, then this operation fails with the following message:
{code}
An error has occurred
Error
Error creating subtask in JIRA: Unknown error creating subtask for issue CRUC-4671: null
{code} 

Subtask? null? what? Unknown? I was trying to create an issue!

What if:
* I got to choose to create a subtask, or a top level class?
* I wasn't given the option to create a subtask, if the linked issue was closed?
fields.summary: Allow 'Create Issue' from comment button to also create Top Level Issues

fields.summary: Current repository and recent repositories

fields.description:
This is *generic* for items which have been visited in FishEye/Crucible.

We need an efficient way of:
* Storing the most recently visited item
* Retrieving the most recently visited item (the "current") element
* Retrieving the 5/10 most recently visited items

This needs to be memory, space and database efficient & scalable. We may not need to store more than 5/10 recent elements per type, keep this in mind.

Speak to JIRA and to Studio, who have both implemented solutions in their products.
fields.summary: Determine information architecture for storing recent items
Store "recently visited" items in FishEye & Crucible

fields.description:
There should be:
* A header element, which is not clickable
* Clickable elements for content
* Separators between groups

Follow the JIRA css
fields.summary: Create styling and markup for drop down header and link elements

fields.description: Check what implementation JIRA use for their dropdowns, and implement the same solution for FE/CRU. Most likely AUI dropdowns?
fields.summary: Identify javascript backend for the dropdowns

fields.description: Styling should look as similar as possible to JIRA. Look at their CSS if you need to.
fields.summary: Create markup and styling for header drop down arrows

fields.description:
When editing a project in Crucible, it will basically load every user in the system and add it to the HTML so that it can populate the *Users* fields.  If you look at the source of this page once it has loaded there will be elements for each user.  When you have many users (20,000+) this page can sometimes never load.

We should update this page to use the Ajax-style selector that's used in the rest of the system so that we don't have to retrieve the entire user list when building the page source.
fields.summary: Improve Project Creation/Editing with large user base

fields.description:
Change the repo dropdown on this page to Antlr:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/qsearch/atlassian?q=brown

{code}
The requested resource cannot be found.
no such repository - Antlr
Referer: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/qsearch/atlassian?q=brown
{code}
fields.summary: Quicksearch: Changing Repository dropdown to Antlr results in 404

fields.description:
Update the FECRU upgrade guides to add instructions for how to run an existing instance in parallel with an in-progress upgrade. See customer quote below:

{quote}_It is critical that upgrade documentation cover how to run an existing instance in parallel with an in-progress upgrade._
_Reindexing of our Git instance took approximately 26 hours. I had to run this twice in order to get branches and tags showing up correctly. This meant that we had almost 60 hours of Fisheye outage last week._
_Giving how long indexing is taking and the need to do it with each upgrade (that has been my experience with all of my upgrades to date), I think a well defined process for upgrading to a new version while running the old version is critical._{quote}
fields.summary: Add instructions for running an existing instance in parallel with an in-progress upgrade

fields.description:
When requesting review data in JSON format, the permaId of comments are always empty.
The XML format of the same request contains a permaId however.

WORKAROUND: use the XML format if possible, until we ship a fix for this in 2.4.2
fields.summary: PermaID field is empty in REST JSON responses

fields.description:
Hitting admin.do#repositories-add or admin.do#repositories-view-reponame pop up a dialog but do not load the list until after the dialog is dismissed. This can be confusing.

!http://img.skitch.com/20101028-d12pkhji3bsfg8m1ranadnpx1r.jpg!
fields.summary: Admin: when add/view repo pages are hit directly, they show no repositories in the background until the add/view is complete

Geoff has a handle on the problem; apparently one of the rows at the bottom is rendering an extra <td>

fields.summary: addGeneralComment fails when called outside a HTTP request. e.g. a plugin commit listener

fields.description: Customers have reported on a couple of occasions that they are unable to remove AppLinks from the Admin console.  The UI says that the App Link is deleted, but when the page refreshes it's still there.  There are no errors in the logs.
fields.summary: Cannot delete Application Links when Fisheye is behind proxy

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) User sends a request to get password reset. 
2) That succeeds, and receives an email msg with the new password. 
3) That new password works, and signs in. 
4) Goes to the Change Password window in Settings. Enters the password from the email msg, and the new password. 

An error "Incorrect password" is displayed despite using a valid password. 

Workaround is to have administrator change your password or to continue using the password sent by email in step 2.
fields.summary: Cannot change password for user

fields.description:
When you add a pre-commit patch, the encoding "US-ASCII" is by default selected.

Maybe it would be possible to use the UserAgent and RequestedLocale of the request (or another HTTP header?) to select pre-select the default encoding of the patch.

(Maybe at least "MacRoman" for MacOS, "Windows-1252" for Windows, if it is possible to be more precise).
fields.summary: Adding a pre-commit patch should select the default encoding of the system

fields.description: I can't scroll code in review on iPad.
fields.summary: Scrolling codeis broken for iPad

fields.description:
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/5f2f4ab8-9485-47cf-89b0-749206efd18e/long%20lines%20fail.png!

CSS
is
Awesome.
fields.summary: Snippets with really long words are insubordinate.

fields.description:
The column width under "Source" tab is restricted to a predefined size. This causes lengthy repository names to be truncated.
It would be helpful to have this width be auto-adjusted as per the size of the longest name in the list or allow users to expand it as per their requirement.
fields.summary: Make column width under "Source" tab configurable

fields.description:
The "No repositories match the filter "Filter repositories"" error message is written in to one of the table's columns and should be colspan-ed across all the columns.

And it should have error styling.

And it probably shouldn't even be an error. The message appeared on page load and seems to being erroring on the default text
fields.summary: Admin Repositories messages are jammed in to one column in the table

fields.description:
According to this documentation it looks like Review Coverage Report is part of Crucible 2.2
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE022/Review+Coverage+Report#ReviewCoverageReport-OpeningtheReviewCoverageReport

However this feature was introduced only in Confluence 2.3
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+2.3+Release+Notes#Crucible2.3ReleaseNotes-ReviewCoveragereport

Thanks,
Dusan
fields.summary: Update docs for Review Coverage Report

fields.description:
This breaks login with errors such as: 

{noformat}java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: :///admin/admin.do
at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpURI.parse2(HttpURI.java:166)
at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpURI.parse(HttpURI.java:109)
at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpURI.<init>(HttpURI.java:91)
at org.mortbay.jetty.Response.sendRedirect(Response.java:406)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseWrapper.sendRedirect(HttpServletResponseWrapper.java:136)
at org.mortbay.servlet.GzipFilter$GZIPResponseWrapper.sendRedirect(GzipFilter.java:331)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseWrapper.sendRedirect(HttpServletResponseWrapper.java:136)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseWrapper.sendRedirect(HttpServletResponseWrapper.java:136)
at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageResponseWrapper.sendRedirect(PageResponseWrapper.java:181)
at org.apache.taglibs.standard.tag.common.core.RedirectSupport.doEndTag(RedirectSupport.java:148)
at org.apache.jsp.admin.index_jsp._jspx_meth_c_redirect_0(index_jsp.java:80)
at org.apache.jsp.admin.index_jsp._jspService(index_jsp.java:55)
at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:109){noformat} 

or

{noformat}
com.atlassian.streams.api.common.uri.Uri$UriException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: java.net.URISyntaxException: Expected scheme name at index 0: ://:443/activity?local=true&use-accept-lang=true&maxResults=7
        at com.atlassian.streams.api.common.uri.Uri.parse(Uri.java:110)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.atom.abdera.AbderaAtomFeedParser.readFeed(AbderaAtomFeedParser.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider$FeedResponseHandler.readStream(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:570)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider$FeedResponseHandler.handle(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:551)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider$FeedResponseHandler.handle(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:531)
        at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.ApplicationLinkRequestAdaptor$1.handle(ApplicationLinkRequestAdaptor.java:87)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest$2.handle(JerseyRequest.java:166)
        at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.executeAndReturn(HttpClientRequest.java:336)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.executeAndReturn(JerseyRequest.java:161)
        at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.ApplicationLinkRequestAdaptor.execute(ApplicationLinkRequestAdaptor.java:84)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider.fetch(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:425)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider.access$200(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:96)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider$1.call(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:179)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.AppLinksActivityProvider$1.call(AppLinksActivityProvider.java:171)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.FeedBuilder$ToFeedCallable$1.call(FeedBuilder.java:112)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.FeedBuilder$ToFeedCallable$1.call(FeedBuilder.java:107)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LimitedExecutor$Runner.run(LimitedExecutor.java:93)
        at com.atlassian.sal.core.executor.ThreadLocalDelegateRunnable.run(ThreadLocalDelegateRunnable.java:38)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:724)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: java.net.URISyntaxException: Expected scheme name at index 0: ://:443/activity?local=true&use-accept-lang=true&maxResults=7
        at com.atlassian.streams.api.common.uri.DefaultUriParser.parse(DefaultUriParser.java:44)
        at com.atlassian.streams.api.common.uri.Uri.parse(Uri.java:102)
        ... 23 more
Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Expected scheme name at index 0: ://:443/activity?local=true&use-accept-lang=true&maxResults=7
        at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2829)
        at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3027)
        at java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:595)
        at com.atlassian.streams.api.common.uri.DefaultUriParser.parse(DefaultUriParser.java:40)
        ... 24 more
{noformat}

To replicate add the following to config.xml: 

{code:xml}
<proxy-info proxy-host="" proxy-scheme=""/>
{code} 

We should constrain the scheme such that proxy scheme is one of \[http,https\]. We should validate the proxy host does not consist only of whitespace and is not 0 characters long. 

The admin UI (Adminsitration -> Global Settings -> Server) allows you to enter only spaces (but doesn't allow the empty strings above) to there needs to be validation there as well. 

The fix for this should be constrained to the UI and only allowing users to save proxy-hosts and proxy-schemes which form a valid URL.

We need not do any extra checking on startup, other than failing to start and logging a helpful error message, which is currently the case, I believe ?
fields.summary: Empty strings accepted in proxy-host / proxy-scheme

fields.description:
1. Join Review should be a Tools-level button to match the Review page.
2.  When you comment on a snippet, you are automatically joined.  The Join Review option to disappear when you comment (currently only happens on page reload).

!http://img.skitch.com/20101025-g2s4a341tkap2j2a1f4jjewt34.jpg!
fields.summary: Snippet Page: Join Review issues

fields.description:
When typing into the Add Reviewers box, or clicking the drop-down when Editing the details of a Crucible review, the box sits there and spins. This only occurs in IE8 (both normal and compatibility modes). It works fine in Firefox and Chrome.

The javascript error is:
{panel}Message: Object expected
Line: 1552
Char: 21
Code: 0
URI: https://server.com/static/lakf91/concat.crucible.695eb5e134d6851390f6136d2b44c166.cache.js
{panel}

which appears to be failing on 
{code}parsed.push(parser(r));{code}
because 
{code}parser = eval('(' + resp.parser + ')');{code}
is not successfully creating a parser.  {{resp.parser}} appears to contain a function {{function (user){var participant = ...}}

And for some reason IE8 doesn't seem to handle creating a function using a string in an eval statement.  Some web research mentions that IE8 doesnt seem to handle creating functions from strings very well, and you should instead use the "Function" method.

http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/iewebdevelopment/thread/9a26ac3e-5ba6-4a42-8cee-d00d917dff41
fields.summary: Reviewers dropdown in Crucible Reviews spins forever in IE8 - cannot add reviewers

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a snippet
# Trying to print the snippet via _Tools -> Print_

The following message is displayed:

{noformat}
javax.el.PropertyNotFoundException: The class 'com.cenqua.crucible.actions.snippet.PrintSnippetAction' does not have the property 'snippetSyntax'.
The class 'com.cenqua.crucible.actions.snippet.PrintSnippetAction' does not have the property 'snippetSyntax'.

You are running release CR2.4.0 FE2.4.0 (20101020013901 2010-10-20), please report your release number when reporting bugs. 
{noformat}

Please see this [screenshot|^snippet.png] for a clearer picture.
fields.summary: PropertyNotFoundException when Priting Snippet

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Navigate to _Administration -> Repository Settings -> Repositories -> <RepositoryName> -> Permissions_
# Under the "LDAP Authentication" section, there is a "LDAP la la la" text

Please see this [screenshot|^LDAP.png] for a clearer picture

It would be good if there are some descriptions to describe the "LDAP restriction" and "Match Type" fields as outlined in this [page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/LDAP+Authentication#LDAPAuthentication-PerRepositorySettings].
fields.summary: No Description for Repository LDAP Settings

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA activity items are provided by a copy of the Activity Streams plugin deployed in WEB-INF/lib. This is less than ideal--- among other things it makes it difficult for further development to streams because custom fecru artifacts need to be deployed.

One solution to this is to make external activity item providers a plugin point. Then the JIRA activity items can be provided by a plugin that depends on streams.
fields.summary: Create a plugin point for external activity item providers

fields.description:
I have a review where one file was renamed by removing it and adding it in SVN.  The re-addition of the file is missing from the review even though it's clearly in the changeset.  The changeset was merged to a branch and in the same review the re-addition on the branch *is* shown.

https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-CONF-1181#c33097
fields.summary: Renamed (deleted & added) file missing from review

fields.description:
Crucible shows "You spent 0m" and offers the submit time link, which gives an error on submit. Increase the minimum checked time to make sure it only shows if a JIRA-safe minute has been spent.

Stop this message:
!http://img.skitch.com/20101025-cd2pc87yxi2x273gmw2bken2gq.jpg!
fields.summary: On Review close, don't show time if its less than one minute

fields.description: The PermId class is missing the @XmlRootElement annotation, which means that any REST requests returning a response with that class in the object heirarchy will fail when JSON is requested.
fields.summary: PermId element can not be serialized to JSON for REST requests
